title: Images show 'professional beggar' change from brand new clothes into scruffy rags to plead for cash
text:
News Images show 'professional beggar' change from brand new clothes into scruffy rags to plead for cash Onlooker “could not believe his eyes” as he watched the man in a “brand new” blue jacket and “smart trainers” change into “scruffy” clothes before bedding down in a sleeping bag Share The 'professional beggar' changed into scruffy clothes and bedded down in a sleeping bag to plead for donations (Photo: Liverpool Echo) Share Get daily   
These images allegedly show a professional beggar change from brand new clothes into scruffy rags before spending a day outside a railway station pleading for cash. 
They were taken in Liverpool city centre - where the mayor, Joe Anderson, is leading a crackdown against so-called professional beggars who give those genuinely in need a bad name by tricking passers-by into handing over their money. 
The pictures were taken by a passer-by outside a railway station and handed to the media by the mayor's office. 
The man who took them, who does not wish to be named, said he “could not believe his eyes” as he watched the man in a “brand new” blue jacket and “smart trainers” change into “scruffy” clothes before bedding down in a sleeping bag and begging for change. An onlooker "couldn't believe his eyes" as he saw the 'beggar' change outfits (Photo: Liverpool Echo) Read More Violent beggars “gutted” man in savage city centre knifing after he refused to hand over money at cashpoint 
The eyewitness told the Liverpool Echo : “As I was walking past Moorfields (railway station), it was the bright blue jacket that actually caught my eye because it was so nice and then I spotted his really nice trainers. 
“But I couldn’t believe what I was seeing because he was putting scruffy trousers and a big old coat over the top of them, there was a girl next to me who was also watching in disbelief. 
“I decided to quickly take photographs because I think it shows the problem that is happening in the city, I was shocked at what I was seeing and thought people should see it.” The mayor of Liverpool believes professional beggars are coming into the city from outside to target tourists (Photo: Liverpool Echo) Read More Food bank volunteer brutally beaten again after leaving hospital following attack that left him in coma 
Mayor Anderson has recently announced he is pulling together a special team to clamp down on professional beggars operating in the city centre. 
He said he is aware of people who are not homeless, coming from outside the city to spend their days begging for change and giving those genuinely in need a bad name. 
The mayor said the images illustrate the practice of “professional begging” taking place on the streets of the city centre. The 'professional beggar' was snapped by a horrified witness (Photo: Liverpool Echo) Read More Tories accused of 'spinning the statistics' on homelessness after criticism by watchdog 
He said: “This backs up what we have been saying, we are not targeting people who need our support - we are targeting those who are taking advantage of the people of Liverpool who are getting money under false pretences. 
“We aren’t going after people who are clearly in need, it is the people who will not co-operate that we are focusing on. 
“Everyone can see what this person is doing, he was outside Moorfields putting different clothes on top of his clothes - this is begging and it is getting out of hand.” 
“This is an issue that is blighting the city and putting tourists off from coming here.” Like us on Facebook
